column1: Ormal was one of the Two Lamps of the Valar
column3: filled by Varda and hallowed by Manwë in the south of the world while the Valar still dwelt on Almaren. It was destroyed by Morgoth at least five ages before the beginning of the First Age.  The destruction created the Sea of Ringil
column4: south of the Sea of Helcar.This Sea is not mentioned in the published Silmarillion.

column1: The name apparently means "Lofty gold" or "High-gold". Obviously it is composed of the Elvish roots OR and MAL.
